questions.text: A 66-year-old man with a newly diagnosed high-grade colon carcinoma is undergoing molecular profiling of the tumor. The oncology team discusses common genetic alterations that drive tumorigenesis and aid treatment planning. Which of the following is least likely to be found as a driver mutation in cancer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Indels in oncogenes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oncogenes are most often activated by specific point mutations, while tumor suppressor genes undergo loss-of-function through indels, deletions, or epigenetic silencing.
  • ➤ Oncogenes are most often activated by specific point mutations, while tumor suppressor genes undergo loss-of-function through indels, deletions, or epigenetic silencing.

questions.text: A 56-year-old man came to your OPD for a routine MHC. He is a non-smoker, drinks occasionally, and has no major medical history. Exam revelas a palpable spleen and BP of 142/88 mmHg. Labs: Hemoglobin: 19.8 g/dL, Hematocrit: 58%, WBC: 14,800/μL, Platelets: 460,000/μL, SpO₂: 96% on room air. What is the recommended first line treatment?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Phlebotomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Phlebotomy is first-line therapy in low-risk PV to control hematocrit and reduce thrombosis.

questions.text: A 70-year-old retired teacher is evaluated after routine blood tests reveal a high total protein. He feels well and reports no symptoms. Labs: creatinine 1.0 mg/dL, calcium 9.8 mg/dL, albumin 4.1 g/dL, hemoglobin 12.8 g/dL. Further testing shows serum monoclonal IgG (3.1 g/dL) and bone marrow with 15% clonal plasma cells. What is the next best step in management?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Perform a PET-CT scan

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Imaging (PET-CT or MRI) is essential to distinguish smoldering from active myeloma before treatment or observation.
  • ➤ Imaging (PET-CT or MRI) is essential to distinguish smoldering from active myeloma before treatment or observation.

questions.text: A 67-year-old man receiving unfractionated heparin for pulmonary embolism develops a platelet drop from 160,000/μL to 85,000/μL on day 6 of treatment. He has no bleeding but complains of mild right leg pain and swelling. What is the most appropriate next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue heparin and wait for antibody test results

options.label: B
options.text: Stop heparin and withhold all anticoagulation

questions.correct_answer: C. Stop heparin and start Argatroban
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Stop heparin and start argatroban

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When HIT is suspected, stop all heparin and switch to a non-heparin anticoagulant such as argatroban immediately.
  • ➤ When HIT is suspected, stop all heparin and switch to a non-heparin anticoagulant such as argatroban immediately.

questions.text: Which of the following risk factors is associated with both adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Cigarette smoking

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 63-year-old man undergoing chemotherapy with paclitaxel and carboplatin for stage IIIB lung adenocarcinoma presents with a fever of 38.3°C. There is erythema near the catheter reported by ICU staff nurse (shown in the image below). Blood cultures are negative at 48 hours, neutrophil count is 1550/μL. What is the most appropriate management?

options.label: C
options.text: Treatment with topical antibiotics at the catheter site

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Treatment with vancomycin alone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 64-year-old man presents with 3 weeks of progressive fatigue, gingival bleeding, and easy bruising. Exam reveals pallor, splenomegaly, and scattered ecchymoses. questions.text: A 56-year-old woman undergoes a haplo-identical bone marrow transplant for poor-risk acute myeloid leukemia. Which of the following is most likely to occur within the first 30 days after bone marrow transplantation?
questions.explanation:

questions.text: A 24-year-old man is admitted for induction chemotherapy for newly diagnosed acute lymphoblastic leukemia. Which of the following is not routinely recommended in the prevention of tumor lysis syndrome?
questions.correct_answer: D. Prophylactic hemodialysis prior to chemotherapy
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Prophylactic hemodialysis prior to chemotherapy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Routine TLS prophylaxis includes hydration, uric acid control, and electrolyte monitoring. Prophylactic dialysis is not indicated unless renal failure is already present.
